title: Reminiscences of childhood at Inverkeithing;
author: Simson, James
snippet: Early next day we embarked at Charlestown for Newhaven in a little steamtug called the Lion — which was painted black, white, and green, and "clinker-built" — and picked up the rest of the family  at the Ferry.

title: Reminiscences of childhood at Inverkeithing;
author: Simson, James
snippet: The business of the district seemed to be at Charlestown,

title: Reminiscences of childhood at Inverkeithing;
author: Simson, James
snippet: Once I recollect being with him, a little towards Rosyth, when he stopped his cart and pointed out the spot where, on passing long before daybreak for Charlestown for a load of lime, he was attacked by a bulldog coming out of a tinker's tent, when he took his "gully" and cut its throat.
